sen.j: 大伴子君（おおとも の こきみ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: OTOMO no Kokimi (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period.
OTOMO no Kokimi (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period in Japan.
OTOMO no Kokimi (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period in Japan.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Sukune.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Sukune.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Sukune.

sen.j: 有力氏族の大伴氏に属するが、子君の系譜は不明。
sen.e: He belonged to the powerful clan, the Otomo clan, but the genealogy has remained unknown.
He belonged to the powerful clan, the Otomo clan, but his genealogy is unknown.
sen.cmt: the genealogy →his genealogy has remained unknown →is unknown
sen.e: He belonged to the powerful clan, the Otomo clan, but his genealogy is unknown.

sen.j: 693年に新羅への使者になった。
sen.e: In 693, he became an envoy to Shilla (ancient Korean kingdom).
In 693, he became an envoy to Silla (ancient Korean kingdom).
In 693, he became an envoy to Silla (ancient Korean kingdom).
His official rank was Gondaini (the nineteenth grade of the forty-eight official ranks)..
His official rank was Gondaini (the nineteenth of the forty-eight official ranks)..
sen.cmt: gradeは他のファイルへの修正に習い省略しました。
sen.e: His official rank was Gondaini (the nineteenth of the forty-eight official ranks)..

sen.j: 子君の名は、『日本書紀』の持統天皇7年（693年）3月乙巳（16日）条にだけ見える。
sen.e: His name was only described in the article of the Emperor Jito on March 16, 693 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
His name was only mentioned in the article of the Emperor Jito on March 16, 693 within "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
His name was only mentioned in the article of the Emperor Jito on March 16, 693 within "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: その日に新羅への使者として息長老と大伴子君、学問僧弁通、神叡が絁（あしぎぬ）、綿、布を賜った。
sen.e: On that day, the envoy to Shilla including OKINAGA no Oyu, OTOMO no Kokimi, Bentsu and Shinei who were both monks received thick silk fabric, cotton and cloth.
On that day, the envoy to Silla including OKINAGA no Oyu, OTOMO no Kokimi, Bentsu and Shinei who were both monks received thick silk fabric, cotton and cloth.
On that day, the envoy to Silla including OKINAGA no Oyu, OTOMO no Kokimi, Bentsu and Shinei who were both monks received thick silk fabric, cotton and cloth.

sen.j: 息長老は前年11月8日にやはり新羅への使者として川内連とともに禄を賜っているが、そこに子君は見えない。
sen.e: On November 8, 692, OKINAGA no Oyu and KAWAUCHI Muraji received roku (reward) because of being an envoy to Shilla, but nothing about Kokimi was described there.
sen.cmt: 「川内連」の読み方不明のため、KAWAUCHI Muraji としました。
sen.e: On November 8, 692, OKINAGA no Oyu and KAWAUCHI Muraji received roku (reward) for his service as an envoy to Silla, but nothing about Kokimi was described there.
sen.cmt: Shilla→Sillabecause of being an envoy →or his service as n envoy
sen.e: On November 8, 692, OKINAGA no Oyu and KAWAUCHI Muraji received roku (reward) for his service as an envoy to Silla, but nothing about Kokimi was described there.

sen.j: 何かの事情で彼らの出発が遅れ、子君が連と交代したのではないかと推測される。
sen.e: It is presumed that Kokimi was replaced by Muraji because their departure was delayed due to some reasons.
The departure was delayed for some reason, and t is presumed that Kokimi was replaced by Muraji.
sen.cmt: 前後関係を修正しました。
sen.e: The departure was delayed for some reason, and t is presumed that Kokimi was replaced by Muraji.

sen.j: 出発、帰国の記事はない。
sen.e: There is no record about their departure and returning home.
There is no record of their departure or return.
sen.cmt: こなれた表現ではなかったため修正しました。
sen.e: There is no record of their departure or return.
